article: There's a small cross by the side of Highway128, near the town o Boonville. If this cross could talk, it would tell you this _ story: Seven years ago my brother, Michael, was at a friend's farm. They decided to go out for dinner. Joe arrived and _ to drive--after just one _ . _ , the four friends traveled the winding road. They didn't know where it would end ---- _ did. Suddenly, they turned _ into the opposite lane , running into an oncoming car. _ home we were watching E.T. on video in front of a warm fire. Then we went to bed. At 2:00 am a police officer _ my mom with the shocking _ . Michael had been killed. In the morning, I _ my mother and sister crying. I stood there _ . "What's wrong?" I asked, rubbing my _ eyes. Mom took a deep breath. "Come here..." Thus began a difficult _ through grief, where all roads lead to nowhere. It _ hurts to remember that day. The only thing tat helps is telling my story, _ you will remember it _ you want to get into a car with someone who has had a drink ---- even just one drink. Joe chose the road to _ . He was convicted of manslaughter and served time. However, the real punishment is living with the consequences of his actions. He left us _ and ache in our hearts that will never go away, a nightmare that will _ him--- and us ---- or the rest of our lives. And a small cross by the side of Highway 128.
